channel.title: Athlon X4 860K
channel.description:
$80. 860K Quad-Core 3.7GHz Processor.
Why aren't you using the Athlon X4 860K?
Also, just because this is a GD thread, what processor are you using? What is the next processor you are going to buy? If you could be using any processor right now, which one would you have, and what cooling?

item.title: Athlon X4 860K
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Idk, wouldn’t you want a more powerful CPU so you don’t need to upgrade as soon tho? Like yeah, if you’re on a budget you can’t spend more on sure but really the sweetspot for most gamers/devs is i5/8350.

I have an i5 4690k (upgraded from an i5 3570k as I had to RMA my motherboard) and an i7 3630qm in my laptop. I think I’ll upgrade when theirs a noticeable performance difference for me which probably wont be for like 3 years. My dream CPU would be an i7 5960x + a custom hardline acrylic watercooling loop but you know that could easily set me back £1600 so that’s never gonna happen :(.

Read full topic

item.title: Athlon X4 860K
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

It’s good for light gaming and general use, it’s a better value than an i3, though the Pentium G3258 might be better if you OC it up. Obviously high clock speed doesn’t make up for the lower single-threaded performance and smaller cache…but it’s really a great budget processor and other than an APU, if you want to build a PC for less, it’s an awesome part.

Read full topic

item.title: Athlon X4 860K
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:3, topic:548534”]I’m currently using the AMD-FX 8350 and I love it!

I have been using AMD since the early 2000’s and never regretted the switch.[/quote]For once…we agree on something. AMD is great for everything anybody needs in a computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Athlon X4 860K
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

My 6300 is holding up quite well. I always loved the power to price ratio when it comes to AMD products, but I feel the market probably teeters pretty good. Either way, it has been a solid CPU for the past year or so.

Read full topic
